result.execSummary:
The defendant Melinda M Dupont was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melinda M Dupont is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Melinda M Dupont was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Melinda M Dupont was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CF663 and 14CM1612 called: 10:09am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person/in custody (on EM) and with Atty Kyle Reimann.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed in 14CF663; Review only on 14CM1612;  VRCW on 14CF663

State notes parties are still awaiting test results in case 14CM1612 and will ask for that hearing to be reset to a subsequent date when that information is received - COURT grants.

COURT receives Amended Information as filed today by State in 14CF663
State moves to:
Ct. 3 (Misd Retail Theft)>>DISMISS
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (Misd Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST
Ct. 2 (Misd Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 140 days MCJ on each count, concurrent to each other and to sentence defendant is now serving in 14CM737, w/credit for one day of time already served in each count, w/huber for work and treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, and COURT does not object to EM if defendant eligible/EM available; CC - to set up payment plan at COC office.

Adj: 10:19am
Plea hearing on October 15, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): Walmart.
